metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
resource group name where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
subscription id where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

properties.displayName: Cloudflare (Using Blob Container) (via Codeless Connector Framework)

connectorUiConfig.title: Cloudflare (Using Blob Container) (via Codeless Connector Framework)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The Cloudflare data connector provides the capability to ingest Cloudflare logs into Microsoft Sentinel using the Cloudflare Logpush and Azure Blob Storage. Refer to [Cloudflare documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/logs/about/)for more information.

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

customs.name: Create a storage account and a container
customs.description: Before setting up logpush in Cloudflare, first create a storage account and a container in Microsoft Azure. Use [this guide](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/blobs/storage-blobs-introduction) to know more about Container and Blob. Follow the steps in the [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-account-create?tabs=azure-portal) to create an Azure Storage account.

customs.name: Generate a Blob SAS URL
customs.description: Create and Write permissions are required. Refer the [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/translator/document-translation/how-to-guides/create-sas-tokens?tabs=Containers) to know more about Blob SAS token and url.

customs.name: Collecting logs from Cloudflare to your Blob container
customs.description: Follow the steps in the [documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/logs/get-started/enable-destinations/azure/) for collecting logs from Cloudflare to your Blob container.

instructionSteps.title: Connect Cloudflare Logs to Microsoft Sentinel
instructionSteps.description:
To enable Cloudflare logs for Microsoft Sentinel, provide the required information below and click on Connect.
>

parameters.label: The Blob container's URL you want to collect data from
parameters.name: blobContainerUri

parameters.label: The Blob container's storage account resource group name
parameters.name: StorageAccountResourceGroupName

parameters.label: The Blob container's storage account location
parameters.name: StorageAccountLocation

parameters.label: The Blob container's storage account subscription id
parameters.name: StorageAccountSubscription

parameters.label: The event grid topic name of the blob container's storage account if exist. else keep empty.
parameters.description:
The data flow using event grid to send 'blob-created event' notifications. There could be only one event grid topic for each storage account.
Go to your blob container's storage account and look in the 'Events' section. If you already have a topic, please provide it's name. Else, keep the text box empty.
parameters.name: EGSystemTopicName

Refer to [Cloudflare documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/logs/about/)for more information.

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

properties.displayName: Cloudflare (Using Blob Container) (via Codeless Connector Framework)

connectorDefinitionName.defaultValue: Cloudflare (Using Blob Container) (via Codeless Connector Framework)

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

Review the solution Release Notes

There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

The Cloudflare solution provides the capability to ingest Cloudflare logs into Microsoft Sentinel using the Codeless Connector Framework (CCF) and Azure Blob Storage. Refer to Cloudflare documentation for more information.

Underlying Microsoft Technologies used:

  1. Codeless Connector Framework

  2. Azure Monitor HTTP Data Collector API (for reference, legacy support)

Data Connectors: 1

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
